meanings.def: high in rank or status; higher in rank or status than others
examples: a senior official/officer/manager/executive
a senior adviser/analyst/lecturer
a senior partner in a law firm
She is senior vice president of marketing.
senior figures in the Labour party
senior members of staff
a senior position
a senior post/job
I have ten years' experience at senior management level.
(British English) Junior nurses usually work alongside more senior nurses.
He is a former senior civil servant who now runs a campaign website.
senior to somebody He is senior to me.
The meeting should be chaired by the most senior person present.
She wasn't senior enough to take such a decision.
I'm looking for a more senior position.
She's a senior lecturer at the university.
There have been large pay rises for the senior grades.

meanings.def: for adults or people at a more advanced level
examples: to take part in senior competitions
his first game of senior football
He won the senior men's 400 metres.

meanings.def: for senior citizens (= older people, especially those who have retired from work)
examples: Get one third off rail fares with a senior railcard.
senior discounts/concessions

meanings.def: used after the name of a man who has the same name as his son, to make it clear who is being referred to
for children over the age of 11 or 13
connected with the last year in high school or college
examples: the senior prom

meanings.def: a person who is older than somebody else
examples: She was ten years his senior.
My brother is my senior by two years.

meanings.def: an older person, especially somebody who has retired from work. People often call somebody a ‘senior citizen’ to avoid saying that they are old or using the expression ‘old-age pensioner’.
a person who is higher in rank or status
examples: She felt unappreciated both by her colleagues and her seniors.

meanings.def: adults or people who have reached an advanced level
examples: tennis coaching for juniors and seniors

meanings.def: a child at a senior school; an older child in a school
(in the US and some other countries) a student in the last year at a high school or college
examples: high school seniors
